title: installation issue: googletest@1.8.0, shared library rpath is wrong on Darwin
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install googletest@1.8.0 # Builds just fine
$ pushd $(spack location -i googletest@1.8.0)/lib
$ otool -L libgtest.dylib
$ popd
```

Current workaround: `module load googletest` whenever I want to link to it, but I shouldn't need to do so.

### Platform and user environment

My OS is macOS 10.12.6:

```commandline
$ uname -a 
Darwin Uvalde.llnl.gov 16.7.0 Darwin Kernel Version 16.7.0: Thu Jun 21 20:07:39 PDT 2018; root:xnu-3789.73.14~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64
$ lsb_release -d
-bash: lsb_release: command not found
``` 

### Additional information

The error was diagnosed while building a separate library (not in spack -- one I develop). The output below should have as the second line of output some path including a spack hash:

```console
$ pushd $(spack location -i googletest@1.8.0)/lib
$ otool -L libgtest.dylib
libgtest.dylib:
	libgtest.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
	/usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 307.5.0)
	/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1238.60.2)
$ popd
```

Compare the above to running a similar set of commands on the `lua` package:

```console
$ pushd $(spack location -i lua)/lib
liblua.dylib:
	/Users/oxberry1/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-9.0.0-apple/lua-5.3.4-654nxxyjaa3ux3to5jxrpft2pilzrgpr/lib/liblua.dylib.5.3.4 (compatibility version 5.3.0, current version 5.3.4)
	/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1238.60.2)
```

The output of `spack-build.out` hints at what _might_ be going on; it's worth noting that I'm using a Homebrew-installed CMake 3.12.1. The two snippets that seemed most relevant are:

```console
CMake Warning (dev):
  Policy CMP0042 is not set: MACOSX_RPATH is enabled by default.  Run "cmake
  --help-policy CMP0042" for policy details.  Use the cmake_policy command to
  set the policy and suppress this warning.

  MACOSX_RPATH is not specified for the following targets:

   gtest
   gtest_main

This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.
```

and

```console
error: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/install_name_tool: for: /Users/oxberry1/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-9.0.0-apple/googletest-1.8.0-mnxlvco6lhjzrkedmusu7mdqghewmf2b/lib/libgtest.dylib (for architecture x86_64) option "-add_rpath /Users/oxberry1/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-9.0.0-apple/googletest-1.8.0-mnxlvco6lhjzrkedmusu7mdqghewmf2b/lib" would duplicate path, file already has LC_RPATH for: /Users/oxberry1/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-9.0.0-apple/googletest-1.8.0-mnxlvco6lhjzrkedmusu7mdqghewmf2b/lib
error: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/install_name_tool: for: /Users/oxberry1/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-9.0.0-apple/googletest-1.8.0-mnxlvco6lhjzrkedmusu7mdqghewmf2b/lib/libgtest.dylib (for architecture x86_64) option "-add_rpath /Users/oxberry1/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-9.0.0-apple/googletest-1.8.0-mnxlvco6lhjzrkedmusu7mdqghewmf2b/lib64" would duplicate path, file already has LC_RPATH for: /Users/oxberry1/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-9.0.0-apple/googletest-1.8.0-mnxlvco6lhjzrkedmusu7mdqghewmf2b/lib64
error: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/install_name_tool: for: /Users/oxberry1/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-9.0.0-apple/googletest-1.8.0-mnxlvco6lhjzrkedmusu7mdqghewmf2b/lib/libgtest_main.dylib (for architecture x86_64) option "-add_rpath /Users/oxberry1/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-9.0.0-apple/googletest-1.8.0-mnxlvco6lhjzrkedmusu7mdqghewmf2b/lib" would duplicate path, file already has LC_RPATH for: /Users/oxberry1/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-9.0.0-apple/googletest-1.8.0-mnxlvco6lhjzrkedmusu7mdqghewmf2b/lib

```

The absolute RPATH seems to be set correctly in `CMAKE_INSTALL_RPATH`. Explicitly appending `-DMACOSX_PATH=ON` or `-DMACOSX_PATH=OFF` has no effect; I get the impression the spack "standard CMake options" take precedence because those flags are earlier arguments in the CMake invocation.
